data.name: Hisuian Voltorb
data.flavorText: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

attacks.name: Cheerful Charge
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hisuian Electrode
data.flavorText: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.name: Petilil
data.flavorText: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Lilligant
data.flavorText: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

attacks.name: Twister Lutz
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Mamoswine
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Iceberg Press
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Regice
data.flavorText: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.

attacks.name: Regi Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Blizzard Bind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon V, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Dewott
data.flavorText: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Hisuian Basculin
data.flavorText: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

attacks.name: Gather the Crew
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hisuian Basculegion
data.flavorText: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

attacks.name: Grudge Dive
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Bergmite
data.flavorText: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

data.name: Hisuian Avalugg
data.flavorText: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

abilities.name: Massive Ice
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Mountain Gale
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Growlithe
data.flavorText: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

attacks.name: Defensive Posture
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Machamp VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge Buster
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 140 more damage.

attacks.name: G-Max Chi Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use G-Max Chi Strike.

data.name: Cranidos
data.flavorText: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.flavorText: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Breath
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Decidueye VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Star of Fortune
abilities.text: During your turn, you may draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Somersault Feathers
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 30 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Hisuian Qwilfish
data.flavorText: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

data.name: Hisuian Overqwil
data.flavorText: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname "sea fiend." It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Dirty Press
attacks.text: If you have at least 3 Darkness Energy in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Hisuian Sneasler V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Dire Claw
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Darkrai VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Star Abyss
abilities.text: During your turn, you may put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

abilities.name: Baffling
abilities.text: If your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Pokémon V.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

attacks.name: Charge Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Heatran V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Burn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magma Fall
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Origin Forme Palkia V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rule the Region
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hydro Break
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Keldeo
data.flavorText: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

attacks.name: Line Force
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Radiant Greninja
data.flavorText: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Concealed Cards
abilities.text: You must discard an Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Moonlight Shuriken
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Hisuian Typhlosion
data.flavorText: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.

abilities.name: Supernatural Orb
abilities.text: You must discard a Psychic Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Hisuian Typhlosion V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Petrifying Flame
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Hisuian Typhlosion VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hollow Flame
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Shimmering Star
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has exactly 4 damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

data.name: Mismagius
data.flavorText: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

attacks.name: Ominous Prose
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If they have 4 or more cards in their hand, choose all but 3, and your opponent shuffles the chosen cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.

abilities.name: Buddy Catch
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Swirling Slice
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.

attacks.name: Spooky Balloon
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Wyrdeer
data.flavorText: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

abilities.name: Hurried Gait
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Machamp V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge Buster
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.flavorText: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

abilities.name: Vamoose
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Regirock
data.flavorText: Every bit of Regirock's body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what's been lost.

attacks.name: Regi Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Lucario V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crushing Punch
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Decidueye
data.flavorText: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

attacks.name: Piercing Claw
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Direct Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kleavor
data.flavorText: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rocky Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Hisuian Qwilfish
data.flavorText: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

attacks.name: Spiny Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Mightyena
data.flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

abilities.name: Hustle Bark
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon VMAX in play, this Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

data.name: Kricketot
data.flavorText: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Kricketune
data.flavorText: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.

abilities.name: Swelling Tune
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon in play, except any Kricketune, get +40 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Swelling Tune Ability at a time.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.

attacks.name: Honey Courier
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.

attacks.name: Honey Rush
attacks.text: Reveal any number of Sweet Honey cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you revealed in this way.

data.name: Hisuian Lilligant V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dance Gracefully
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Hisuian Lilligant VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Star Perfume
abilities.text: During your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 in any combination of Grass Pokémon and Grass Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Parallel Spin
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. If you do, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.

data.name: Quilava
data.flavorText: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

data.name: Radiant Heatran
data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

attacks.name: Raging Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Starmie V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Spiral
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Piloswine
data.flavorText: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mantine
data.flavorText: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

attacks.name: Borne Ashore
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto that player's Bench.

data.name: Whiscash
data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Glaceon
data.flavorText: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.

attacks.name: Frost Wall
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name "scalchop.".

data.name: Togepi
data.flavorText: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

abilities.name: Touch of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Togetic
data.flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

abilities.name: Voice of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 30 damage from your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Togekiss
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they've hardly been seen at all.

abilities.name: Shine of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 90 damage from your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Diancie
data.flavorText: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

abilities.name: Princess's Curtain
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Rampardos
data.flavorText: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

attacks.name: Jurassic Hammer
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.

data.name: Radiant Hawlucha
data.flavorText: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Big Match
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon VMAX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Hisuian Decidueye V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mountain Hunt
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Kleavor V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Axe Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Overqwil
data.flavorText: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname "sea fiend." It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Tormenting Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 5 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

attacks.name: Pinning
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Hisuian Sneasel
data.flavorText: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.

data.name: Hisuian Sneasler
data.flavorText: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

abilities.name: Carry and Climb
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

data.name: Darkrai V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Void
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Beedrill V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Swarming Sting
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Beedrill V in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Wide Wing
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Leafeon
data.flavorText: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.

attacks.name: Energy Garden
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leafy Cyclone
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

attacks.name: Encouraging Gift
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Heatran VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magma Gain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you have a Stadium in play, you may heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Heat Burst
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

attacks.name: Entangled Dive
attacks.text: Discard each player's Active Pokémon and all attached cards. (You choose a new Active Pokémon first.)

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.

data.name: Origin Forme Palkia VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Star Portal
abilities.text: During your turn, you may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to your Water Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Subspace Swell
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Customized Cane
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Luxray V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fang Snipe
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Radiating Pulse
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Regieleki
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It's said that removing the rings on Regieleki's body will unleash the Pokémon's latent power.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Sonar
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Targeted Bolt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Uxie
data.flavorText: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

attacks.name: Wise Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mesprit
data.flavorText: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

abilities.name: Mental Shroud
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Azelf
data.flavorText: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Hisuian Arcanine
data.flavorText: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

attacks.name: Scorching Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Kleavor
data.flavorText: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

attacks.name: Timber Cleave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Poochyena
data.flavorText: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Swirling Disaster
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Hisuian Samurott
data.flavorText: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

abilities.name: Wily Stance
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Dark Mastery
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Samurott V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hisuian Samurott VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Merciless Blade
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 110 more damage.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: It's accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

attacks.name: Vengeful Cut
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pawniard.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

abilities.name: Resonant Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play a Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your other Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

abilities.name: Stand Sentry
abilities.text: Basic Energy attached to your Benched Pokémon can't be discarded by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards.

data.name: Ursaring
data.flavorText: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.

attacks.name: Continuous Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Jabber On
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Hisuian Braviary
data.flavorText: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.

attacks.name: Bounce Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it's being controlled by some mysterious being.

abilities.name: Giga Magnet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Shieldon
data.flavorText: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

attacks.name: Hard Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Metal Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Regidrago
data.flavorText: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago's arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

abilities.name: Dragon's Hoard
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand. You can't use more than 1 Dragon's Hoard Ability each turn.

data.name: Stantler
data.flavorText: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it's been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.

abilities.name: Miracle Body

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Regigigas
data.flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

attacks.name: Magnetic Catch
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 3 Metal Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Registeel
data.flavorText: Registeel's body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 50 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Bastiodon
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

abilities.name: Primal Fortress

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Bronzor
data.flavorText: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.

attacks.name: Metal Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bronzong
data.flavorText: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

attacks.name: Silent Wing
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.

attacks.name: Gather Food
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Purugly
data.flavorText: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Rufflet
data.flavorText: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Adaman
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 Metal Energy cards from your hand. Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Canceling Cologne
rules: Until the end of your turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon has no Abilities. (This includes Pokémon that come into play during that turn.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Choy
rules: Each player reveals their hand. Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cyllene
rules: Flip 2 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile on top of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Gardenia's Vigor
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play. This card can't retreat.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Grant
rules: During this turn, your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). During your turn, if this Grant is in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards, except any Grant, from your hand. If you do, put this Grant into your hand. (This effect doesn't use up your Supporter card for the turn.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.
